snippet: Two years after California's tough "three strikes and you're out" law went into effect, twice as many defendants have been imprisoned under the law for marijuana possession as for murder, rape and kidnapping combined, according to a new study.    ...
lead_paragraph: Two years after California's tough "three strikes and you're out" law went into effect, twice as many defendants have been imprisoned under the law for marijuana possession as for murder, rape and kidnapping combined, according to a new study. Overall, 85 percent of those receiving stiffer sentences had been convicted most recently of a nonviolent offense, the study found.

headline.main: Tough Law On Sentences Is Criticized

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: CENTER FOR JUVENILE AND CRIMINAL JUSTICE
